reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Ministre du Plan et la Cooperation Internationale (Minsitry of Plannning and International Cooperation)

description.narrative: Chad - HIV - Fonds de soutien aux activités en matière de population et de lutte contre le Sida de la République du Tchad - FOSAP. This program has the following goals: Reduce the prevalence of HIV among most at risk populations (from 20% in 2009 to 10 % in 2018 among sex workers).. Halve new infections in adults and children exposed to HIV by 2018 (from 1.04 new infections per 1000 population (0.73 adult and 1.28 children) in 2014 to 0.45 (0.30 adults and 0.57 children) in 2018).. Halve mortality in adults living with HIV by 2018 (from 91.34 deaths related to HIV / AIDS per 100 000 population in 2014 to 51.4 in 2018).. The objectives of this program are: To improve the treatment success rate of PLHIV on ART: increase the percentage of PLHIV with undetectable viral load from 31 % in 2014 to 80 % in 2018.. To strengthen Health and Community Systems as well as program management.. To reduce mother to child HIV transmission from 32 % in 2014 to 8% in 2018.. To improve access to HIV care and retention of PLHIV on ART: The percentage of PLHIV receiving care for HIV increases from 23 % in 2014 to 46% in 2018, the percentage of PLHIV in ARV treatment increases from 68 % in 2012 to 85% in 2018.. To strengthen low risk behaviours in key populations : The percentage of sexual workers who says they used a condom during their last sexual intercourse increases from 85% in 2012 to 88% in 2018.. To improve condom use among the general population : the percentage of men and women aged 15-49 years who had more than one sexual partner in the last 12 months and who reported using a condom during their last sex increased from 50 % in 2012 to 80 % in 2018..
